p: B100 had a 2 h induction time at 110 Â°C, meaning that it did not meet the quality requirements, which is 3 h according to ASTM D 6741 and D 2274 standards, and 6 h [ 10, 33] according to EN 14112. Nonetheless, this value was far exceeded by the samples treated with antioxidant, as seen in Table 4. These results are like those reported by van der Westhuizen, in which biodiesel from sunflower oil showed an OSI time of between 2 and 6 h [ 12]. The original low OSI of biodiesel can be attributed to the chemical composition, due to the high concentration of unsaturated FAME [ 7].
